sentence.Network_en: Moreau took gold in the five-kilometre individual pursuit competition.
sentence.Network_cn: 莫罗在个人五公里追逐赛中获得金牌。

sentence.Network_en: His single-minded pursuit of European union helped chase Mrs Thatcher from power.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对欧洲统一的执著追求在一定程度上促成了撒切尔夫人的下台。

sentence.Network_en: Relentless in his pursuit of quality, his technical ability was remarkable.
sentence.Network_cn: 对质量孜孜不倦的追求使他的技能出类拔萃。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a person, animal, or vehicle) start to chase another

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French purseute 'following after', from pursuer (see pursue). Early senses included 'persecution, annoyance' and in legal contexts 'petition, prosecution'

entry.def: Your pursuit of something is your attempts at achieving it. If you do something in pursuit of a particular result, you do it in order to achieve that result.

example.ex: ...a young man whose relentless pursuit of excellence is conducted with single-minded determination.
example.tran: 一心一意、坚定不移地追求完美的年轻人

example.ex: ...individuals who impoverish their families in pursuit of some dream.
example.tran: 为了追求某个梦想而使家庭陷于贫困的人

entry.def: The pursuit of an activity, interest, or plan consists of all the things that you do when you are carrying it out.

example.ex: The vigorous pursuit of policies is no guarantee of success.
example.tran: 坚决贯彻方针政策并不能保证成功。

entry.def: Someone who is in pursuit of a person, vehicle, or animal is chasing them.

example.ex: ...a police officer who drove a patrol car at more than 120mph in pursuit of a motor cycle.
example.tran: 以超过每小时120英里的时速驾驶巡逻车追赶一辆摩托车的警官

entry.tran: （自行车赛和滑冰竞赛中的）追逐赛
entry.def: In cycling and skating, the pursuit is a race in which two competitors or teams start on opposite sides of a circular track and try to catch up with each other.

example.ex: Moreau took gold in the five-kilometre individual pursuit competition.
example.tran: 莫罗在个人五公里追逐赛中获得金牌。

entry.def: Your pursuits are your activities, usually activities that you enjoy when you are not working.

example.tran: 他们俩都喜欢户外活动。

example.ex: His favourite childhood pursuits were sailing, swimming and cycling.
example.tran: 儿时他最大的爱好是帆船运动、游泳和骑自行车。

entry.def: If you are in hot pursuit of someone, you are chasing after them with great determination.

example.ex: I rushed through with Sue in hot pursuit.
example.tran: 我冲了过去，苏在后面穷追不舍。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of pursuing in an effort to overtake or capture;

sentences.sentence: "the culprit started to run and the cop took off in pursuit"

means.word_mean: 2. a search for an alternative that meets cognitive criteria;

sentences.sentence: "life is more than the pursuance of fame"

means.word_mean: 3. a diversion that occupies one's time and thoughts (usually pleasantly);

sentences.sentence: "they criticized the boy for his limited pursuits"

auth_sentence.content: Moderation in the pursuit of justice is no virtue.
auth_sentence.res_content: Moderation in the pursuit of justice is no virtue.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Moderation in the pursuit of justice is no virtue.

auth_sentence.content: Science is corrupted in pursuit of funding & ideology.
auth_sentence.res_content: Science is corrupted in pursuit of funding & ideology.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Science is corrupted in pursuit of funding & ideology.

auth_sentence.content: The relentless pursuit of being different is very French.
auth_sentence.res_content: The relentless pursuit of being different is very French.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The relentless pursuit of being different is very French.

stems_affixes.word_buile: suit[v.合适, 适合, 相配]+able……的→adj.适当的, 相配的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不适合的, 不相称的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+suitable[adj.适当的, 相配的]→adj.不适合的, 不相称的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 追赶, 追踪, 追击, 继续, 从事
stems_affixes.word_buile: pur+su跟随,追+e→v.追赶, 追踪, 追击, 继续, 从事

stems_affixes.value_cn: 合适, 适合, 相配
stems_affixes.word_buile: su跟随,追+it走→跟在后面走→相配

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"……人"; 2. 表抽象名词

stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+cru成长+it……人→n.新兵,新分子,新会员 v.补充,征募,征募新兵,复原

stems_affixes.value_cn: 赤字,逆差;亏损,亏空;不足,缺乏
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,不+fic做+it-it,表抽象名词→做得不够→亏空;不足
pursue追赶+it-it,表抽象名词→n.追赶,追求;职业,工作
spir呼吸,精神+it-it,表抽象名词→n.精神;志气;[n.]情绪,心情;[n.]酒精

stems_affixes.value_cn: 补充,征募,征募新兵,复原
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+cru成长+it……人→n.新兵,新分子,新会员 v.补充,征募,征募新兵,复原
cred信任+it表抽象名词→ v.信任;学分

Sentence.sentence: What was the most popular outdoor pursuit in the UK?
There were also differences in the most popular outdoor pursuits between the three countries.
Unfortunately,many American universities seem awfully busy protecting their brand name and not nearly busy enough protecting the pursuit of knowledge.

sentences.cn: 他们立即出发沿着小巷追赶。

sentences.en: Games like chess are rather intellectual pursuits.
